member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Support.Converter.SimpleMessageConverter
member.summary: Implementation of MessageConverter that can work with Strings, Serializable instances, or byte arrays. The ToMessage method simply checks the type of the provided instance while the FromMessage method relies upon the content-type of the provided Message.
member.author: Joe Fitzgerald

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether new messages should have unique identifiers added to their properties before sending. Default is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the codebase URL to download classes from if not found locally. Can consists of multiple URLs, separated by spaces.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Support.Converter.SimpleMessageConverter.DefaultCharset
member.summary: Gets or sets the default charset to use when converting to or from text-based Message body content. If not specified, the charset will be "UTF-8".

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Queue
member.summary: Simple container collecting information to describe a queue.
member.author: Mark Pollack

member.name: F:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Queue.name
member.summary: The name of the queue.

member.name: F:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Queue.durable
member.summary: The durable flag.

member.name: F:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Queue.exclusive
member.summary: The exclusive flag.

member.name: F:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Queue.autoDelete
member.summary: The auto delete flag.

member.name: F:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Queue.arguments
member.summary: The arguments.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Queue.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. The queue is durable, non-exclusive and non auto-delete.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Queue.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, given a name and durability flag. The queue is non-exclusive and non auto-delete.
member.param: The durable. True if we are declaring a durable queue (the queue will survive a server restart).

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Queue.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, given a name, durability, exclusive and auto-delete flags.
member.param: The durable. True if we are declaring a durable queue (the queue will survive a server restart).
The exclusive. True if we are declaring an exclusive queue (the queue will only be used by the declarer's connection).
The auto delete. True if the server should delete the queue when it is no longer in use.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Queue.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, given a name, durability flag, and auto-delete flag, and arguments.
member.param: The durable. True if we are declaring a durable queue (the queue will survive a server restart).
The exclusive. True if we are declaring an exclusive queue (the queue will only be used by the declarer's connection).
The auto delete. True if the server should delete the queue when it is no longer in use.
The arguments used to declare the queue.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Queue.ToString
member.summary: A String representation of the Queue.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Queue.Name
member.summary: Gets Name.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Queue.Durable
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether Durable. A durable queue will survive a server restart.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Queue.Exclusive
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether Exclusive. True if the server should only send messages to the declarer's connection.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Queue.AutoDelete
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether AutoDelete. True if the server should delete the queue when it is no longer in use (the last consumer is cancelled). A queue that never has any consumers will not be deleted automatically.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Queue.Arguments
member.summary: Gets Arguments.

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IMessageCreator
member.summary: Interface for Message creation.
member.author: Mark Pollack

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IMessageCreator.CreateMessage
member.summary: Create a Message.

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpAdmin
member.summary: Specifies a basic set of portable AMQP administrative operations for AMQP > 0.8
member.author: Mark Pollack

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpAdmin.DeclareExchange(Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IExchange)
member.summary: Declares the exchange.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpAdmin.DeleteExchange(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the exchange.
member.remarks: Look at implementation specific subclass for implementation specific behavior, for example for RabbitMQ this will delete the exchange without regard for whether it is in use or not.
member.returns: true if the exchange existed and was deleted

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpAdmin.DeclareQueue
member.summary: Declares a queue whose name is automatically named by the server. It is created with exclusive = true, autoDelete=true, and durable = false.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpAdmin.DeclareQueue(Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Queue)
member.summary: Declares the given queue.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpAdmin.DeleteQueue(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the queue, without regard for whether it is in use or has messages on it
member.returns: true if the queue existed and was deleted.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpAdmin.DeleteQueue(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes the queue.
member.param: if set to true the queue should be deleted only if not in use.
if set to true the queue should be deleted only if empty.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpAdmin.PurgeQueue(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Purges the queue.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpAdmin.DeclareBinding(Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Binding)
member.summary: Declare a binding of a queue to an exchange.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpAdmin.RemoveBinding(Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Binding)
member.summary: Remove a binding of a queue to an exchange. Note unbindQueue/removeBinding was not introduced until 0.9 of the specification.

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.UncategorizedAmqpException
member.summary: A "catch-all" exception type within the AmqpException hierarchy when no more specific cause is known.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.UncategorizedAmqpException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.AbstractExchange.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, given a name.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.AbstractExchange.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, given a name, durability flag, auto-delete flag.
member.param: The durable flag. true if we are declaring a durable exchange (the exchange will survive a server restart).
The auto delete flag. True if the server should delete the exchange when it is no longer in use.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.AbstractExchange.#ctor(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Collections.IDictionary)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, given a name, durability flag, and auto-delete flag.
member.param: if set to true, if we are declaring a durable exchange (the exchange will survive a server restart)
if set to true the server should delete the exchange when it is no longer in use

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.AbstractExchange.Durable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is durable.
member.value: true if describing a durable exchange (the exchange will survive a server restart), otherwise false.

member.name: P:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.AbstractExchange.AutoDelete
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the auto-delete lifecycle of this exchange.
member.value: true if if the server should delete the exchange when it is no longer in use; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: An non-auto-deleted exchange lasts until the server is shut down.

member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of arbitrary arguments to use when declaring an exchange.

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate
member.summary: Specifies a basic set of AMQP operations
member.remarks: Provides synchronous send an receive methods. The ConvertAndSend and ReceiveAndConvert methods allow let you send and receive POCO objects. Implementations are expected to delegate to an instance of to perform conversion to and from AMQP byte[] payload type.
member.author: Mark Pollack

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.Send(Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Message)
member.summary: Send a message to a default exchange with a default routing key.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.Send(System.String,Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Message)
member.summary: Send a message to a default exchange with a specific routing key.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.Send(System.String,System.String,Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Message)
member.summary: Send a message to a specific exchange with a specific routing key.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.ConvertAndSend(System.Object)
member.summary: Convert a .NET object to an Amqp and send it to a default exchange with a default routing key.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.ConvertAndSend(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Convert a .NET object to an Amqp and send it to a default exchange with a specified routing key.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.ConvertAndSend(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Convert a .NET object to an Amqp and send it to a specified exchange with a specified routing key.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.ConvertAndSend(System.Object,System.Func{Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Message,Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Message})
member.summary: Convert a .NET object to an Amqp and send it to a default exchange with a default routing key.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.ConvertAndSend(System.String,System.Object,System.Func{Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Message,Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Message})
member.summary: Convert a .NET object to an Amqp and send it to a default exchange with a specified routing key.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.ConvertAndSend(System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.Func{Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Message,Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Message})
member.summary: Convert a .NET object to an Amqp and send it to a specified exchange with a specified routing key.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.Receive
member.summary: Receive a message if there is one from a default queue. Returns immediately, possibly with a null value.
member.returns: A message or null if there is none waiting.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.Receive(System.String)
member.summary: Receive a message if there is one from a specific queue. Returns immediately, possibly with a null value.
member.returns: A message or null if there is none waiting.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.ReceiveAndConvert
member.summary: Receive a message if there is one from a default queue and convert it to a .NET object. Returns immediately, possibly with a null value.
member.returns: A message or null if there is none waiting.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.ReceiveAndConvert(System.String)
member.summary: Receive a message if there is one from a specified queue and convert it to a .NET object. Returns immediately, possibly with a null value.
member.param: The name of the queue to poll.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.SendAndReceive(Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Message)
member.summary: Basic RPC pattern. Send a message to a default exchange with a default routing key and attempt to receive a response. Implementations will normally set the reply-to header to an exclusive queue and wait up for some time limited by a timeout.
member.returns: The response if there is one.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.SendAndReceive(System.String,Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Message)
member.summary: Basic RPC pattern. Send a message to a default exchange with a specified routing key and attempt to receive a response. Implementations will normally set the reply-to header to an exclusive queue and wait up for some time limited by a timeout.
member.returns: The response if there is one.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.SendAndReceive(System.String,System.String,Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Message)
member.summary: Basic RPC pattern. Send a message to a specified exchange with a specified routing key and attempt to receive a response. Implementations will normally set the reply-to header to an exclusive queue and wait up for some time limited by a timeout.
member.returns: The response if there is one.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.ConvertSendAndReceive(System.Object)
member.summary: Basic RPC pattern with conversion. Send a .NET object converted to a message to a default exchange with a default routing key and attempt to receive a response, converting that to a .NET object. Implementations will normally set the reply-to header to an exclusive queue and wait up for some time limited by a timeout.
member.returns: The response if there is one.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.ConvertSendAndReceive(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Basic RPC pattern with conversion. Send a .NET object converted to a message to a default exchange with a specified routing key and attempt to receive a response, converting that to a .NET object. Implementations will normally set the reply-to header to an exclusive queue and wait up for some time limited by a timeout.
member.returns: The response if there is one.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.ConvertSendAndReceive(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Basic RPC pattern with conversion. Send a .NET object converted to a message to a specified exchange with a specified routing key and attempt to receive a response, converting that to a .NET object. Implementations will normally set the reply-to header to an exclusive queue and wait up for some time limited by a timeout.
member.returns: The response if there is one.

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.IAmqpTemplate.ConvertSendAndReceive(System.Object,System.Func{Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Message,Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Message})
member.summary: Basic RPC pattern with conversion. Send a .NET object converted to a message to a default exchange with a default routing key and attempt to receive a response, converting that to a .NET object. Implementations will normally set the reply-to header to an exclusive queue and wait up for some time limited by a timeout.
member.returns: The response if there is one.

member.summary: Basic RPC pattern with conversion. Send a .NET object converted to a message to a default exchange with a specified routing key and attempt to receive a response, converting that to a .NET object. Implementations will normally set the reply-to header to an exclusive queue and wait up for some time limited by a timeout.
member.returns: The response if there is one.

member.summary: Basic RPC pattern with conversion. Send a .NET object converted to a message to a specified exchange with a specified routing key and attempt to receive a response, converting that to a .NET object. member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.CustomExchange
member.summary: Simple container collecting information to describe a custom exchange. Custom exchange types are allowed by the AMQP specification, and their names should start with "x-" (but this is not enforced here). Used in conjunction with administrative operations.
member.author: Joe Fitzgerald

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Address
member.summary: Represents an address for publication of an AMQP message. The AMQP 0-8 and 0-9 specifications have an unstructured string that is used as a "reply to" address. There are however conventions in use and this class makes it easier to follow these conventions.
member.author: Mark Pollack

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Address.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from an unstructured string

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Address.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class given the exchange type, exchange name and routing key. This will set the exchange type, name and the routing key explicitly.

member.name: T:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Message
member.summary: The 0-8 and 0-9-1 AMQP specifications do not define an Message class or interface. Instead, when performing an operation such as basicPublish the content is passed as a byte-array argument and additional properties are passed in as separate arguments. Spring AMQP defines a Message class as part of a more general AMQP domain model representation. The purpose of the Message class is to simply encapsulate the body and properties within a single instance so that the rest of the AMQP API can in turn be simpler.
member.author: Mark Pollack

member.name: M:Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.Message.#ctor(System.Byte[],Spring.Messaging.Amqp.Core.MessageProperties)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Format the message as a string.
member.returns: The string representation of the message.

member.summary: Format the body content as a string.
member.returns: The string representation of the body content.
